building_identifier: Unique identifier attribute present in input footprint source
input_footprint: Input 2D vector file with building footprint(s)
input_footprint_select: Feature number to load (value must be in the range 1 to number of features in foootprint input)
input_pointcloud: Input pointcloud. Should contain building (6) and ground class (2)
output_ogr: OGR vector output file or DB connection string
output_ogr_EPSG: EPSG code for the Coordinate Reference System of OGR output
output_ogr_format: OGR vector output format (eg GPKG or PostgreSQL)
output_ogr_overwrite: Overwrite OGR vector output. If false then output is appended in case of existing file
r_line_epsilon: maximum distance between detected line and its inliers
r_lod13_step_height: Step height used in LoD1.3 generalisation; roofparts with a height difference smaller than this value are merged
r_normal_k: number of neighbors used for normal estimation
r_optimisation_data_term: Increase to get more detailed models. Decrease to get more simplified/generalised models.
r_plane_epsilon: maximum distance between plane and its inliers
r_plane_k: number of neighbors used for region growing plane detection
r_plane_min_points: minimum number of inliers in each plane
skip_attribute_name: name of boolean attribute in input footprints that tells if the building should be skipped for full LoD1.3+ reconstruction. Eg used for greenhouses and very big industrial buildings, since these are difficult/slow to process due to glass roofs and large footprint area.
